titles: An elegy on the death of the right noble Prince Henry Howard, Duke of Norfolk, who departed this life the 13th. day of this instant January, 1684.
publisher: Printed for I. Deacon, at the Angel in Guilt-spur-street, without New-Gate,
notes: VerseL: "Norfolk is dead like lightning, which no part ..."
Place of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Norfolk, Henry Howard, --  Duke of, 1628-1684 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
